net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.custom.pattern

Class AbstractUiWidgetCustomMasterDetail<VALUE,SELECTION,DETAIL>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.feature.AbstractUiFeatureValueAndValidation<VALUE>
      • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.AbstractUiWidget<VALUE>
        • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.custom.UiWidgetCustom<VALUE,DELEGATE>
          • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.custom.UiWidgetCustomComposite<VALUE,UiWidgetRegular,UiWidgetDynamicPanel<UiWidgetRegular>>
            • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.widget.custom.pattern.AbstractUiWidgetCustomMasterDetail<VALUE,SELECTION,DETAIL>
  • Type Parameters:
    VALUE - is the generic type of the value. Typically bound to List<SELECTION>.
    SELECTION - is the generic type of the individual row from the master list.
    DETAIL - is the generic type of the actual value representing the <SELECTION> that gets set in the details panel.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    AttributeReadAriaRole, AttributeReadEnabled, AttributeReadHtmlId, AttributeReadMode, AttributeReadModeFixed, AttributeReadModified, AttributeReadPrimaryStyle, AttributeReadStyles, AttributeReadStylesAdvanced, AttributeReadTooltip, AttributeReadValueAdvanced<VALUE>, AttributeReadVisible, AttributeReadVisibleRecursive, AttributeWriteEnabled, AttributeWriteHtmlId, AttributeWriteMode, AttributeWriteModeFixed, AttributeWriteModified, AttributeWriteOnlyFocused, AttributeWritePrimaryStyle, AttributeWriteStyles, AttributeWriteStylesAdvanced, AttributeWriteTooltip, AttributeWriteValueAdvanced<VALUE>, AttributeWriteVisible, AttributeWriteVisibleAdvanced, UiFeature, UiFeatureEvent, UiFeatureMessages, UiFeatureMode, UiFeatureValidation<VALUE>, UiFeatureValue<VALUE>, UiFeatureValueAndValidation<VALUE>, UiWidget, UiWidgetAbstractComposite, UiWidgetAbstractWithValue<VALUE>, UiWidgetComposite<UiWidgetRegular>, UiWidgetRegular, UiWidgetWithValue<VALUE>, AttributeReadDisposed, AttributeReadId<String>, AttributeReadValue<VALUE>, AttributeWriteDisposed, AttributeWriteId<String>, AttributeWriteValue<VALUE>, Accessibility, AbstractValidatableObject, HasValueValidators<VALUE>, ValidatableObject<VALUE>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    UiWidgetCustomMasterDetail

    public abstract class AbstractUiWidgetCustomMasterDetail<VALUE,SELECTION,DETAIL>
extends UiWidgetCustomComposite<VALUE,UiWidgetRegular,UiWidgetDynamicPanel<UiWidgetRegular>>
    This is the abstract base class for a custom composite widget that implements the UI pattern master/detail (panel). It combines a master panel that allows selecting an object that automatically gets displayed in the details panel and can typically be edited there.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

    • Method Detail

      • getMasterPanel

        protected abstract UiWidgetWithValue<VALUE> getMasterPanel()
        Returns:
        the master panel containing the master list.

      • getMasterList

        protected abstract UiFeatureSelectedValue<SELECTION> getMasterList()
        This method gets the actual widget containing a list of <SELECTION> to choose from. This widget has to be a child of the master panel. A selection in the master list will automatically trigger an update of the details panel.
        NOTE:
        The details panel can only display a single <DETAIL> at a time. Therefore if multi-selection is enabled, nothing will be displayed in the details panel. This may still make sense to allow mass-operations such as remove in the master panel.
        Returns:
        the master list.

      • getDetailPanel

        protected abstract UiWidgetCustom<DETAIL,?> getDetailPanel()
        This method gets the details panel showing the detail for the current selection from the master list. If the <DETAIL> should be editable for the user, this details panel will typically be an editor.
        Returns:
        the details panel.

      • doInitialize

        protected void doInitialize()
        This method is called from UiWidgetCustom.initialize() but only if called for the first time. You may override this method to add additional initialization logic. Then do not forget the super call.
        ATTENTION:
        Never call this method directly.
        Overrides:

      • doGetValue

        protected VALUE doGetValue(VALUE template,
                           ValidationState state)
                    throws RuntimeException
        This method is called from the data-binding triggered by API methods such as AbstractUiFeatureValueAndValidation.getValue(). In many cases the data-binding already performs the required work to do. However, here is the place to implemented the custom logic to get the value from the actual widget. The following cases have to be distinguished:
        • For native fields this method has to get the actual value from the underlying native widget (text-box, password-field, etc.).
        • For custom fields this method will be responsible to convert from the delegates value (see UiWidgetCustom.getDelegate()) to the proper value type. E.g. if you want to create a custom widget to edit your own datatype such as CustomerNumber based on a UiWidgetTextField you need to convert from String to CustomerNumber.
        • For custom composite widgets you should use AbstractUiWidget.getDataBinding(). UiDataBinding.createAndBind(net.sf.mmm.util.pojo.path.api.TypedProperty) that gives you high-level support and makes your live easy. Then there is no need to override this method.
        • For other cases, especially if <VALUE> is Void, there is nothing to do here.
        The implementation of this method has to correspond with the implementation of AbstractUiWidget.doSetValue(Object, boolean) .

        If you do not want to use the advanced data-binding you could override this method and manually implement the binding like in the following example:
         protected Person doGetValue(Person template, ValidationState state) {

   Person result = super.doGetValue(template, state);
   // if the attribute is a datatype we can supply null (instead of result.getFirstName())
   result.setFirstName(this.widgetFirstName.getValueDirect(null, state));
   result.setLastName(this.widgetLastName.getValueDirect(null, state));

   Address address = this.widgetAddressPanel.getValueDirect(result.getAddress(), state);
   this.widgetAddressExtraPanel.getValueDirect(address, state);
   result.setAddress(address);
   ...

   return result;
 }
        You may also mix the advanced data-binding with custom logic implemented in this method.
        Overrides:
        doGetValue in class UiWidgetCustomComposite<VALUE,UiWidgetRegular,UiWidgetDynamicPanel<UiWidgetRegular>>
        Parameters:
        template - is the object where the data is filled in. May only be null if according to data-binding (e.g. if <VALUE> is an (immutable) Datatype).
        state - is the ValidationState. May be null (if the validation is omitted). Should only be used to propagate to AbstractUiWidget.getValueDirect(Object, ValidationState) of children.
        Returns:
        the current value of this widget. May be null if empty. If <VALUE> is String the empty String has to be returned if no value has been entered. In case <VALUE> is a mutable object (java bean) the template is NOT null and is to be returned by this method after the value(s) of this widget have been assigned. For immutable datatypes template will be null and this method has to create a new instance of <VALUE> based on the end-users input in the widget.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException
        See Also:
        AbstractUiWidget.doSetValue(Object, boolean)

      • doSetValue

        protected void doSetValue(VALUE value,
                          boolean forUser)
        This method is called from the data-binding triggered by API methods such as AbstractUiWidget.setValue(Object, boolean). In many cases the data-binding already performs the required work to do. However, here is the place to implemented the custom logic to get the value from the actual widget. For details see AbstractUiWidget.doGetValue(Object, ValidationState).

        If you do not want to use the advanced data-binding you could override this method and manually implement the binding like in the following example:
         protected void doSetValue(Person value) {
   this.widgetFirstName.setValue(value?.getFirstName());
   this.widgetLastName.setValue(value?.getLastName());
   ...
 }
        Overrides:
        doSetValue in class UiWidgetCustomComposite<VALUE,UiWidgetRegular,UiWidgetDynamicPanel<UiWidgetRegular>>
        Parameters:
        value - is the value to set. Typically a composite object (e.g. java bean) so its attributes are set to fields (see UiWidgetField).
        forUser - true if called from AbstractUiFeatureValueAndValidation.setValueForUser(Object), false if set from AbstractUiFeatureValueAndValidation.setValue(Object).
        See Also:
        AbstractUiWidget.doGetValue(Object, ValidationState)
